sect1.title: Zend_Mobile_Push Introduction
sect1.para: Zend_Mobile_Push provides the ability for sending push notifications to the vendor specific notification servers. Currently this list includes APNS (iTouch/iPad/iPhone), GCM (Google Android) and MPNS (Windows Phone).

Since many of the underlying implementations vary; please see each specific notification class for usage details. Outlined below are details on the common functionality that exists between the implementations.

sect2.title: Common Functionality
sect2.para: While each individual push notification adapter contains specific functionality; there are commonalities that have been attempted to make implementation of the adapters easier.

row.entry: Generally only utilized for APNS; however, assists in maintaining the connection state.
Allows you to see if you are already connected.
Allows you to pass in a message to send. This will send the message to the corresponding system. Note that the send method for APNS will lazily connect if you are not already connected.
Allows you to set options in bulk for the adapters.

sect2.para: Each individual message varies in implementation; again like adapters there are some commonalities that have been addressed to ensure consistency between messages.

row.entry: Allows you to set or get the token or device id / unique id that is for any specific device. For APNS this is the device ID, for GCM it is the registration id and for MPNS it equates to the push url.
Sets the distict message id that you would give a message.
Allows you to set a messages options in bulk.
Does a very simple test on the message to ensure that it can be sent through the adapter.
